storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to configure approval workflows to manage schedule change approvals

testCases.title: Validate creation of multi-stage approval workflow
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
ApprovalWorkflows and Approvers tables are accessible
At least one role and department exist in the system

steps.action: Administrator navigates to workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Page displays existing workflows and creation options with 'Create New Workflow' button visible

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: New workflow creation form is displayed with fields for workflow name, description, and stage configuration

steps.action: Administrator enters workflow name and description
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name and description are accepted and displayed in the form

steps.action: Administrator adds first approval stage and assigns approvers by role
steps.expectedResult: First stage is created with selected role displayed as approver

steps.action: Administrator adds second approval stage and assigns approvers by department
steps.expectedResult: Second stage is created with selected department displayed as approver

steps.action: Administrator adds third approval stage and assigns specific approvers
steps.expectedResult: Third stage is created with all assigned approvers displayed correctly in the workflow stages list

steps.action: Administrator reviews the complete multi-stage workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: All workflow stages and approvers are displayed correctly in sequential order

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Save' button to save the workflow
steps.expectedResult: System processes the save request within 3 seconds, displays success message, and workflow appears in the workflows list

steps.action: Administrator navigates to workflow version history
steps.expectedResult: Version history shows new entry with creation timestamp, administrator username, and version 1.0

postconditions: New multi-stage approval workflow is saved in ApprovalWorkflows table
Workflow is active and available for use
Version history entry is created with initial version
Configuration changes are logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Verify validation prevents circular dependencies
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
Workflow configuration page is accessible
System validation rules for circular dependencies are active

steps.action: Administrator navigates to workflow configuration page and clicks 'Create New Workflow'
steps.expectedResult: New workflow creation form is displayed

steps.action: Administrator enters workflow name 'Test Circular Workflow'
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name is accepted and displayed

steps.action: Administrator creates Stage A with approver from Role 1
steps.expectedResult: Stage A is created and displayed in workflow

steps.action: Administrator creates Stage B with approver from Role 2 and sets Stage A as next stage
steps.expectedResult: Stage B is created with Stage A configured as next stage

steps.action: Administrator attempts to configure Stage A to route back to Stage B, creating a circular dependency
steps.expectedResult: System detects circular dependency configuration

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Save' button to save the workflow
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message: 'Circular dependency detected. Stage A cannot route to Stage B as it would create an infinite loop.' Save operation is prevented

steps.action: Administrator removes the circular routing from Stage A
steps.expectedResult: Circular dependency is removed and workflow structure is corrected

steps.action: Administrator configures Stage A to route to Stage C (new final stage)
steps.expectedResult: Stage A is now correctly configured to route to Stage C without circular dependency

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Save' button again
steps.expectedResult: Validation passes, workflow is saved successfully within 3 seconds, and success message is displayed

postconditions: Workflow is saved without circular dependencies
Validation error was properly displayed and prevented invalid save
Corrected workflow is active in the system
Version history reflects the successful save

testCases.title: Test escalation rule configuration
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
At least one approval workflow exists in the system
Escalation approvers and roles are configured in the system

steps.action: Administrator navigates to workflow configuration page and selects existing workflow to edit
steps.expectedResult: Workflow details page is displayed with current configuration

steps.action: Administrator clicks on 'Escalation Rules' tab or section
steps.expectedResult: Escalation rules configuration interface is displayed

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Add Escalation Rule' button for Stage 1
steps.expectedResult: Escalation rule form is displayed with fields for timeout duration and escalation approver

steps.action: Administrator sets escalation timeout to 24 hours for Stage 1
steps.expectedResult: Timeout value of 24 hours is accepted and displayed

steps.action: Administrator selects escalation approver as 'Department Manager' role
steps.expectedResult: Department Manager role is selected and displayed as escalation approver

steps.action: Administrator adds second escalation rule for Stage 1 with 48 hours timeout escalating to 'Director' role
steps.expectedResult: Second escalation rule is added and both rules are displayed in correct sequence

steps.action: Administrator reviews escalation rules configuration
steps.expectedResult: All escalation rules are displayed correctly in workflow details showing timeout periods and escalation approvers for each stage

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Save' button to save the workflow with escalation rules
steps.expectedResult: System processes save request within 3 seconds and displays success message 'Workflow with escalation rules saved successfully'

steps.action: Administrator refreshes the workflow details page
steps.expectedResult: Workflow displays with all escalation rules persisted correctly showing Stage 1: 24h → Department Manager, 48h → Director

steps.action: Administrator checks version history
steps.expectedResult: Version history shows new entry indicating escalation rules were added with timestamp and administrator username

postconditions: Escalation rules are saved and associated with the workflow
Workflow with escalation rules is persisted in ApprovalWorkflows table
Escalation rules are active and will trigger based on configured timeouts
Version history is updated with escalation rule changes

storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to audit approval workflows and actions to ensure compliance and traceability

testCases.title: Validate audit logging of workflow configuration changes
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
AuditLogs table is accessible and functioning
At least one approval workflow exists in the system
Audit logging service is active and operational

steps.action: Administrator navigates to workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration page is displayed with list of existing workflows

steps.action: Administrator selects an existing workflow to modify
steps.expectedResult: Workflow details page is displayed with current configuration

steps.action: Administrator modifies workflow name from 'Schedule Approval' to 'Schedule Change Approval'
steps.expectedResult: Workflow name is updated in the form

steps.action: Administrator adds a new approval stage to the workflow
steps.expectedResult: New approval stage is added and displayed in workflow configuration

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Save' button to save the modified workflow
steps.expectedResult: Workflow is saved successfully within 3 seconds and success message is displayed

steps.action: Administrator navigates to audit logs section from the admin portal menu
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs page is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Administrator searches audit logs for workflow configuration changes using workflow name 'Schedule Change Approval'
steps.expectedResult: Search executes within 5 seconds and returns audit log entries related to the workflow

steps.action: Administrator reviews the most recent audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is displayed showing: Action Type: 'Workflow Modified', User: current administrator username, Timestamp: current date/time, Details: 'Workflow name changed from Schedule Approval to Schedule Change Approval, Stage added'

steps.action: Administrator clicks on the audit log entry to view detailed metadata
steps.expectedResult: Detailed audit entry displays complete information including before/after values, IP address, session ID, and all modified fields

steps.action: Administrator filters audit logs by action type 'Workflow Modified' and date range of today
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results display only workflow modification entries from today, showing all relevant entries accurately within 5 seconds

postconditions: Audit log entry is created and stored in AuditLogs table
Audit entry contains complete metadata including user, timestamp, and change details
Audit log is immutable and cannot be modified
Search functionality returns accurate results

testCases.title: Verify audit log immutability
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
AuditLogs table contains existing audit entries
Audit log immutability protection is enabled
System security controls are active

steps.action: Administrator navigates to audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs page is displayed with existing audit entries

steps.action: Administrator selects an existing audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry details are displayed in read-only view

steps.action: Administrator attempts to access edit functionality for the audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: No edit button or edit functionality is available; entry is displayed in read-only mode only

steps.action: Administrator attempts to use browser developer tools or direct API call to modify the audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: System prevents modification and returns error response: 'Audit log entries are immutable and cannot be modified'

steps.action: System logs the unauthorized modification attempt
steps.expectedResult: New audit log entry is created documenting the attempted modification with Action Type: 'Unauthorized Audit Modification Attempt', User: administrator username, Timestamp: current date/time

steps.action: Administrator attempts to delete an audit log entry through the UI
steps.expectedResult: No delete button or delete functionality is available for audit log entries

steps.action: Administrator attempts to use direct API call to delete the audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: System prevents deletion and returns error response: 'Audit log entries cannot be deleted', HTTP status 403 Forbidden

steps.action: System logs the unauthorized deletion attempt
steps.expectedResult: New audit log entry is created documenting the attempted deletion with Action Type: 'Unauthorized Audit Deletion Attempt', User: administrator username, Timestamp: current date/time

steps.action: Administrator searches audit logs for unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: Both unauthorized modification and deletion attempts are displayed in audit logs with complete details

postconditions: Original audit log entry remains unchanged and intact
All unauthorized access attempts are logged in audit trail
System security controls prevented tampering
Audit log integrity is maintained

testCases.title: Test audit log export functionality
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the admin portal with valid credentials
Administrator has admin role permissions
AuditLogs table contains multiple audit entries
Export functionality is enabled and operational
Administrator has appropriate file download permissions

steps.action: Administrator navigates to audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs page is displayed with existing audit entries and export options

steps.action: Administrator applies filters to select specific audit logs (e.g., date range: last 7 days, action type: Workflow Modified)
steps.expectedResult: Filtered audit log entries are displayed matching the selected criteria within 5 seconds

steps.action: Administrator clicks 'Export' button and selects 'CSV' format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears confirming CSV format selection with estimated record count

steps.action: Administrator confirms CSV export
steps.expectedResult: System processes export request and CSV file begins downloading within 5 seconds

steps.action: Administrator opens the downloaded CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all filtered audit log entries with columns: Timestamp, User, Action Type, Details, IP Address, Session ID. Data matches the displayed audit logs exactly

steps.action: Administrator verifies data integrity in CSV by comparing sample entries with UI display
steps.expectedResult: All data in CSV matches corresponding entries in the audit logs UI with correct formatting and no data loss

steps.action: Administrator returns to audit logs page and clicks 'Export' button, then selects 'PDF' format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears confirming PDF format selection with estimated record count

steps.action: Administrator confirms PDF export
steps.expectedResult: System processes export request and PDF file begins downloading within 5 seconds

steps.action: Administrator opens the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully and displays formatted audit log entries with proper headers, company branding, page numbers, and export timestamp

steps.action: Administrator verifies data completeness in PDF by reviewing entries and comparing with UI display
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all filtered audit log entries with proper formatting, readable text, and organized layout. Data matches the audit logs UI exactly

steps.action: Administrator checks audit logs for export actions
steps.expectedResult: New audit log entries are created documenting both export actions with Action Type: 'Audit Log Exported', Format: CSV/PDF, User: administrator username, Record Count, Timestamp

postconditions: CSV file is successfully downloaded with correct audit data
PDF file is successfully downloaded with formatted audit data
Both export actions are logged in audit trail
Exported data matches source audit logs exactly
Files are available in administrator's download folder

storyTitle: As Administrator, I want to manage user roles and permissions for schedule change approval workflows to ensure secure access

testCases.title: Validate creation and assignment of user roles
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the user management portal
Administrator has valid authentication credentials with admin privileges
UserRoles and Permissions tables are accessible
At least one user account exists in the system for role assignment

steps.action: Navigate to the user management portal and access the roles management section
steps.expectedResult: Roles management interface is displayed with options to create, edit, and delete roles

steps.action: Click on 'Create New Role' button
steps.expectedResult: Role creation form is displayed with fields for role name and permissions selection

steps.action: Enter role name 'Scheduler' in the role name field
steps.expectedResult: Role name is accepted and displayed in the input field

steps.action: Select specific permissions: 'Submit Schedule Changes' and 'View Schedule History' from the permissions list
steps.expectedResult: Selected permissions are highlighted and marked as assigned to the role

steps.action: Click 'Save Role' button
steps.expectedResult: Role 'Scheduler' is created successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and role appears in the roles list with assigned permissions within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the user assignment section for the newly created 'Scheduler' role
steps.expectedResult: User assignment interface is displayed showing available users and currently assigned users

steps.action: Select a user from the available users list and click 'Assign to Role' button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully assigned to the 'Scheduler' role and appears in the assigned users list

steps.action: Log out as administrator and log in as the newly assigned user
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and can access schedule change submission features according to assigned permissions

steps.action: Verify the user can submit schedule changes but cannot approve them
steps.expectedResult: User can access and use the schedule change submission feature but approval features are not visible or accessible

postconditions: New 'Scheduler' role exists in the system with defined permissions
User is assigned to the 'Scheduler' role
User can access features according to role permissions
Role creation is logged in the audit trail

testCases.title: Verify audit logging of role changes
preconditions: Administrator is logged into the user management portal
At least one user role exists in the system (e.g., 'Approver' role)
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
Administrator has permissions to view audit logs

steps.action: Navigate to the roles management section and select an existing role 'Approver'
steps.expectedResult: Role details are displayed showing current permissions and assigned users

steps.action: Click 'Edit Role' button for the 'Approver' role
steps.expectedResult: Role editing form is displayed with current permissions pre-selected

steps.action: Add a new permission 'Configure Approval Workflows' to the existing permissions
steps.expectedResult: New permission is selected and highlighted in the permissions list

steps.action: Click 'Save Changes' button
steps.expectedResult: Role permissions are updated successfully, confirmation message is displayed within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the audit logs section of the user management portal
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Filter audit logs by 'Role Changes' and search for the 'Approver' role modification
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry is displayed showing the role modification event

steps.action: Verify the audit log entry contains the administrator username who made the change
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the correct administrator username

steps.action: Verify the audit log entry contains the accurate timestamp of the change
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the timestamp matching the time when the change was saved

steps.action: Verify the audit log entry contains details of the permission added
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows 'Configure Approval Workflows' permission was added to 'Approver' role

postconditions: Role permissions are updated in the system
Audit log entry exists with 100% accuracy including user, timestamp, and change details
Audit trail maintains data integrity

testCases.title: Test enforcement of role-based access control
preconditions: Multiple user roles exist in the system (e.g., 'Scheduler', 'Approver', 'Administrator')
A test user account exists with 'Scheduler' role assigned (no approval permissions)
Schedule change approval features are configured and accessible to authorized roles
Role-based access control is enabled system-wide

steps.action: Log in to the system as a user with 'Scheduler' role (no approval permissions)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and is authenticated

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management section
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface is displayed with features available to the 'Scheduler' role

steps.action: Attempt to access the 'Approve Schedule Changes' feature by clicking on the approval menu or directly navigating to the approval URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an error message is displayed: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access this feature'

steps.action: Verify that approval-related buttons and menu items are not visible in the user interface
steps.expectedResult: Approval features are hidden from the navigation menu and interface for users without approval permissions

steps.action: Attempt to access the approval feature using direct API endpoint call (POST /api/schedule-approvals)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out and log in as a user with 'Approver' role
steps.expectedResult: User with 'Approver' role successfully logs in

steps.action: Navigate to the 'Approve Schedule Changes' feature
steps.expectedResult: Approval feature is accessible and displays pending schedule changes for approval

steps.action: Verify the access attempt by the 'Scheduler' role user is logged in the security audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Security log contains entry showing unauthorized access attempt with user details and timestamp

postconditions: Unauthorized access is prevented and logged
Role-based access control is enforced across all schedule change approval features
No security breach or unauthorized data access occurred
Users can only access features appropriate to their assigned roles
